title: How a startup loses its spark
dot:
digraph WorkExperience{node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgray, fontname="Helvetica"]; subgraph cluster_0{label="Seed Stage Startup";style=dashed;color=lightblue; intoxicating[label="Intoxicating Work Experience"]; core_loop[label="Core Loop:
1. Talk to Users
2. Build Ideas
3. Discuss
4. Implement
5. Ship & Celebrate"]; small_team[label="Fun at <10 People:
- Direct User Interaction
- Freedom in Ideas
- Collaborative Coworkers
- Fast Implementation
- Shared Success"]; intoxicating->core_loop->small_team;} subgraph cluster_1{label="Larger Company";style=dashed;color=lightcoral; enjoyable[label="Enjoyable Work Experience"]; scaled_loop[label="Scaled Loop:
1. User Interaction by PMs
2. Restricted Idea Freedom
3. Uninterested Coworkers
4. Slow Implementation
5. Limited Recognition"]; large_team[label="Challenges at >100 People:
- Reduced Skin in Game
- N^2 Communication
- Reduced Risk Tolerance"]; enjoyable->scaled_loop->large_team;} inevitable[label="Inevitability:
- Employee Increase
- User Base Growth
- Government Regulation"]; preventable[label="Prevention Strategies:
- Avoid Large Company Processes
- Operate Like Startups
- Design Clever Incentives
- Hire Less"]; large_team->inevitable[label="Inevitability"];large_team->preventable[label="Prevention Strategies"];}
